intro: Spergularia segetalis var. pyrenaea, commonly known as the Mediterranean sandspurry, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are narrow and linear, adapted to thrive in sandy or gravelly soils. It is often found in coastal areas and is known for its ability to tolerate salt and drought conditions.
